p: As is clear from Tables 1 to 3, low-concentration aqueous solution samples of Example 2 (solid content: 2%) and Example 3 (solid content: 1%) formed uniform hydrogels having high gel strength and were able to maintain an iron ball on the gel surface. In contrast, the samples of Comparative Example 1 were able to maintain an iron ball on the sample surface, only when the solid content of the aqueous solution sample increased to 8%, which is a threshold concentration higher than that determined in the Examples.
